page.title: 05THE ROYAL OAK BOSCOBEL HOUSE
page.content: The 'Royal Oak' is a large old oak tree, which stands alone in the fields outside Boscobel House. It is said to have grown from an acorn of the tree which sheltered Charles II after the Battle of Worcester in 1661.The tree, which is over 70 feet high and thought to be 310 years old, is surrounded by an iron fence. There is a memorial plaque inside the fence. The fence replaced a wall built over 300 years ago to protect the tree. A sapling from this tree was planted to commemorate Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee in 1897.
